stories.headline: El Busto replaces El Busto
stories.bodyText:
The Colts signed Jones to a one-year, $14M deal after his release from the Giants, and he beat out Richardson in training camp to earn the Week 1 start.

Richardson is the highest-drafted QB in Colts history since Andrew Luck went No. 1 overall in 2012.

stories.headline: Bird gets statue, birds roost
stories.bodyText:
Bird said her first career WNBA points and her final points 20 years later were both layups, making the pose deeply meaningful.

The statue also depicts her wearing Nike Air Zoom Huarache sneakers, the same model she wore during the Storm’s first championship and her first Olympic gold medal in 2004.

stories.headline: Do we need more teams?
stories.bodyText:
While cities like Nashville, Salt Lake City, Montreal, and even Mexico City have been floated, Portland and Charlotte are considered the most logical fits under Manfred’s geographic emphasis.

Portland would give Seattle a natural regional rival, while Charlotte would do the same for Atlanta. The Brewers would move back to the American League for the first time since 1998.

stories.headline: NBA look ahead
stories.bodyText:
Haliburton’s torn Achilles rules him out for 2025-26, and Turner signed with Milwaukee, leaving Indiana significantly weaker despite their Finals run last season.

Haliburton is the second major star in consecutive offseasons (after Ja Morant in 2024) to suffer a catastrophic Achilles injury during the playoffs.

stories.headline: yeah last night was preseason, but...
stories.bodyText:
Burrow opened with a touchdown drive featuring Ja’Marr Chase, then followed with another to Charlie Jones without Chase and Tee Higgins on the field.

Burrow finished 9-of-14 for 62 yards and a 97.2 passer rating, his busiest preseason showing ever with 28 snaps.

stories.headline: What are they hiding???
stories.bodyText:
McVay emphasized “day at a time” and “week at a time” multiple times when pressed on Stafford’s back issue, instead of offering certainty about Week 1.

This isn’t Stafford’s first durability question — back problems also cut short parts of his 2019 season in Detroit.
